So, around the time chapter 1044 came out I got the idea in my head to reread One Piece. I was specifically looking for evidence of Nika anywhere in the story. I read one volume per day for 104 days. I took notes as I went. I was typically reading the Viz translations but I also read fan scans and checked the anime to get an alternate translation to try and figure out what was originally written in the Japanese text.
-Love RH


* 4/1/22 Volume 1
   * Chapter 1
      *  Volume intro: Oda says that pirates were ‘too busy having fun to write down their adventures’ They were actually mostly illiterate
      * Nami is depicted before Zoro despite not being introduced until later
      * Luffy gets angry very quickly
      * The devil fruit just appears in Luffy’s hand, there is no chest on the table like some anime depictions
      * The fruit’s chest had a lock on it
      * Lucky Roux shoots a man in cold blood and doesn’t even put his meat chunk down
      * Luffy called Shanks a coward but got mad that the mountain bandit called Shanks a coward
      * Shanks’s ‘Haki moment’ needs a few panels to take
      * Narrator calls Shanks a good man
   * Chapter 2
      * Alvida’s a fat ugly bitch lol
      * Alvida uses the same weapon as Kaido
      * For some reason the Anime started here
      * Zoro is given the silhouette treatment marking the first Oda Intro
      * First mention of the One Piece by name
      * Pg 20 Luffy smirks but its nii not nika
      * Pg 23 Koby says that Luffy ate of the Gomu Gomu Tree but this is a mistranslation and it is Luffy explaining to Koby what his power is. No tree is mentioned in Japanese
      * First mention of the Grand Line
   * Chapter 3
      * Helmeppo points to a sign that appears out of nowhere and repeats what is written plainly on it
      * Helmeppo orders a marine to throw the girl over the wall literally. Like they don’t just escort her out they lob her like a frisbee
      * I don’t know how much Oda had planned out during the prototypes, but you can really see in the conversation between Zoro and Luffy that there’s space for Luffy to explain the difference between Peacemains and Morganeers
      * The older volumes have activities like drawing pirate flags in them
   * Chapter 4
      * Helmeppo Calls Luffy ‘Baaaaaka’ which was translated as ‘booger face’
      * Viz clearly had an audience for this series in mind which I’m sure will not come back to haunt them
      * Captain Morgan says ‘I’m so great!!’ and even builds a statue of himself despite being squarely in the middle of Navy ranks
      * Captain Morgan says Helmeppo isn’t worth hitting and then proceeds to hit him
      * The statue is “a monument to [his] rank and power”
      * They put the statue on top of a building
      * Koby gets shot in the chest and lives
   * Chapter 5
      * First flashback arc
      * It will later be retconned that Zoro got his original 2 swords from a blacksmith from Wano who lost his mojo and that’s why the swords are crap
      * I can’t believe Kuina actually died from falling down the stairs, that is exactly what happened in Nippon
   * Chapter 6
      * Random sailor refers to the Devil Fruits as, ‘… The secret treasure from those seas!!?’ may or may not be the Grand Line
      * I’ve never understood why swords work on Luffy. Like yeah you can slash a tire but like you have to hit the side where the rubber is thin. Shouldn’t Luffy’s rubber be thick since he has muscles and bones and such?
      * There are several swords that could easily cut Zoro even with his ‘block’
      * Luffy kicks along with punches
      * Pg 10 the bullet hole in Koby has disappeared
      * Morgan orders his guys to shoot themselves and they almost do
      * Pg 19 Koby’s wound is missing at the top of the page, its back at the bottom of the page
      * Zoro actually takes down Morgan
   * Chapter 7
      * Luffy beats the shit out of Koby to prove a point
   * Chapter 8
      * The bird grabbing Luffy by the head gag was used in the pilot
      * Shouldn’t Luffy’s neck start stretching so his body is dangling a mile below his head?
      * Nami perfectly predicts a storm about 5m wide, parks her ship under it, and tricks a pirate crew just in time for them to be shipwrecked by the small storm
      * The buggy pirates mention that Buggy has a devil fruit, for a while (when i was a kid) I thought that meant Buggy would also stretch
      * Luffy starts to get pissy about his hat but earlier Alvida crushed his hat with her mace and he didn’t care
* 4/2/22 Volume 2
   * Chapter 9
      * Oda mentions the lyrics of a northern European pirate song but I can’t find the song anywhere
      * Is it a map of the Grand Line or a map to the Grand Line?
      * Oda very carefully hides Buggy’s left hand while it is choking a guy across the room
      * ‘One hundred million berries is a lot of money’ I wonder about that, sure it’s high for the East Blue but among ‘great pirates’ that seems kind of low
      * Nami’s rejection of Luffy the moment she learns he’s a pirate again reminds me of the Peacemain/Morganeer thing
      * Nami thinks Luffy’s hat has a map hidden inside it, her own greed makes it impossible for her to understand sentimental value
      * Maybe it was intentional but I doubt that; Nami likes money and tangerines, the money is greed but the tangerines are sentimental, yet she puts them on the same level
      * Nami always carries a rope
      * Luffy is put in a cage, couldn’t he just squish his way out. He actually did in one of the pilots
   * Chapter 10
      * The cover page shows a pig wearing that Japanese bandit scarf thing and it has a devil fruit pattern on it, to my knowledge there is no pig fruit
      * Also, so far there are only Paramecia fruits
      * Nami being 4’5” and 70lbs can outdrink the entire Buggy pirate crew
      * I like this panel  
      * Luffy mocks Nami for not having the balls to blast him with a cannon
      * Luffy is actually leaving marks in the bars where he’s chewing. If he had enough time, he could have chewed his way out.
   * Chapter 11
   * Luffy is depicted on the cover racing a leopard. That might be relevant later
   * Buggy is immune to slash, Luffy is immune to blunt
   * Nami: “No pirate would sacrifice himself to save a friend” there are several pirates good and bad that would do this
   * Chapter 12
   * There are a lot of color pages early on, shame they’re printed in black and white
   * There are no sound effects or anything to show this but Luffy must be moving his cage from within the cage
   * The lion attacks a pet food store because it’s hungry. I feel like a lion would want bloody meat not dry kibble
   * Chapter 13
   * Luffy is supposed to be angry about the pet store being destroyed but he looks more bored than anything                          
   * Nami is mad at Luffy because I think she thinks he burned down the pet store? But at the same time, she was with him when the store was burning?
      * Chapter 14
      * “What kind of mayor stands back and watches his town be destroyed!?” in my experience most
      * Chapter 15
      * There’s a bunch of ‘pirate speak’ all over the place, I wonder when that stopped. It wasn’t in the Japanese
      * Buggy’s goal is to rule the Grand Line. Later on, he’s a complete coward. I’m sure this is just a retconning thing but he doesn’t show any plain cowardice in his introduction
      * Chapter 16
      * Chapter 17
      * Unicycle guy calls them kamikaze tops but none of them explode
      * Luffy again says it’s a map of the Grand Line
      * Buggy says Luffy reminds him of a young Shanks, Shanks also said Luffy reminds him of a young Shanks
      * The activity section includes a papercraft Luffy with a stretchy arm
      * 4/3/22 Volume 3
      * Chapter 18
      * Buggy, like Nami, is unable to understand that Luffy can treasure the hat itself
      * Chapter 19
      * Luffy must be using some of that untrained invisible Haki since he smacks buggy around without Buggy coming apart
      * Rayleigh makes his first appearance so does Scopper
      * A wide shot of the ship they are on is shown, it doesn’t quite look like the Oro Jackson and there’s no giant egg
      * Chapter 20
      * Nami decides to mock Buggy while within stabbing range
      * Nami says she’d never take lessons from Buggy despite the fact that they have the same goals and desires
      * Chapter 21
      * There’s a random crosshair on one of Nami’s speech bubble on page 1
      * The Strawhats have been run out of town twice now
      * Chapter 22
      * The hat is apparently easily damaged, later Luffy will fight a dragon and his hat will be completely unharmed
      * I wonder if there were more modern bullets with conical heads would they be able to pierce Luffy?
      * They keep mentioning the Gum-Gum tree but trees were never mentioned. It confused me as a child, made me think there were several copies of any given fruit that all come from the same tree
      * First mention of the Red Line
      * You get a lot of talk early on about people returning from the Grand Line for hype and such but as far as I remember there’s no real way out
      * Luffy has been laughing ‘hahahaha’ not his iconic ‘shishishi’
      * Chapter 23
      * Luffy actually mentions that they need food, not a cook specifically but food. The musician gag hasn’t started yet
      * Usopp’s nose looks almost human compared to his later Pinocchio nose
      * Usopp’s explanation for his daily lie is to make the village less boring
      * Usopp suggests that they go to Kaya for a ship because she’s rich. Not because there’s already a ship there, he doesn’t even ask them to help cheer her up. If I were the Strawhats, I’d assume this is another one of Usopp’s lies
      * Chapter 24
      * Kuro pushes up his glasses, upon re-reading this makes him evil
      * I like to think Kuro was giving Kaya poison instead of medicine since she immediately heals after Kuro is beaten
      * Usopp mentions a land of little people and a giant goldfish
      * Usopp arguing with Kuro about Yasopp’s pirating seems like a spot for Peacemain/Morganeer
      * Chapter 25
      * Interesting that Kuro accuses Usopp of being deceitful and twisting the truth. Usopp’s not really lying to get anything meanwhile Kuro is a master planner so they are good foils.
      * Kuro crying about how he’d never be able to live with himself if she died is disgusting
      * First mention of Shanks being famous from someone who doesn’t know him personally.
      * Chapter 26
      * 4/4/22 Volume 4
      * Chapter 27
      * Usopp is a bad liar. Later he runs around telling the truth emphatically. The villagers call him out specifically because it’s the same lie he always tells. Later he tries to get Kaya away but she thinks he’s lying too. He is clearly emotionally distraught but Kaya thinks he’s trying to get back at Kuro. Like seriously, I could understand if she was confused but she thinks he’s lying. Like neither of them really believed the stories Usopp was telling so why would Kaya think Usopp is actually lying to manipulate her? I get the boy-who-cried-wolf thing but he’s clearly scared and emotionally affected; when he lies, he’s usually happy or hard-faced.
      * The SBS has begun
      * Chapter 28
      * I’ve suddenly noticed that at this stage Oda draws eye pops like this          
      * I don’t get why Kuro destroys the specialized glasses that Kaya bought him. He doesn’t take annoyances lightly so why wouldn’t he take glasses that he doesn’t have to constantly push up. He even says he’ll accept gifts from her
      * Roronoa Zoro is named after a pirate named L’ollonois. For some reason Viz used Rs for the last name and an L in the first name. Its literally the least correct translation possible
         * Chapter 29
         * Luffy has more trouble with direction than Zoro. Despite Luffy getting a head start and Zoro having to climb an oiled slope they actually arrive at the same time implying Zoro is actually quite good at finding his way
         * Chapter 30
         * It is interesting that Luffy gets hypnotized into super strength since it was shown he was susceptible to hypnotism earlier
         * SBS: Luffy by defeating his enemies destroys their will to go on
         * Chapter 31
         * Kaya has a nightmare about Usopp trying to kill her despite the fact that he was almost in tears when she last saw him
         * The skinny meow brother seems like the only one who would actually work under Kuro since he uses underhanded tactics like making Zoro underestimate him and wearing clothes that are too big for him. The rest are just brutes
         * SBS: Nami willing to sell her body for money
         * Chapter 32
         * Momonosuke’s dragon form cameos on the cover art
         * Usopp shoots at the pussy brothers and Zoro gets in the way. Why doesn’t Usopp shoot at Luffy to wake him?
         * Kuro asks what in Neptune’s name is going on, referring of course to the king of the fishmen
         * Chapter 33
         * Chapter 34
         * Luffy is not immune to slash. Luffy takes a chakram to the head like its nothing, he even bleeds
         * Chapter 35
         * First cover story
         * Kuro knows about Devil Fruits
         * Kuro’s glasses break completely but I guess they’re just reading glasses since he only improves in combat past this point
         * 4/5/22 Volume 5
         * Chapter 36
         * Luffy throws boulders like they’re nothing
         * This is the angriest I’ve ever seen Luffy  
         * SBS: There was an OVA before the original anime that takes place between Gaimon and Usopp called, ‘Defeat them! The Ganzak Pirates’
            * Chapter 37
            * Kuro is a pretty boring fight, it might be the first power level fight
            * Kuro being ‘of the thousand plans’ is very unlike the rest of his crew.
            * Kuro is the one who broke Captain Morgan’s jaw. Morgan’s right hand is always conveniently out of frame
            * Luffy breaks Kuro’s claws but a broken sword could still stab good
            * Chapter 38
            * People get hit in the dick a lot in early one piece
            * Proof that this is a power level fight: Luffy out speeds Kuro
            * Kuro goes so fast even he can’t see where he’s going, so he just slashes wildly
            * Chapter 39
            * Django gets kicked in the dick for the third time
            * Chapter 40
            * Usopp, true to the liar he is, decides to lie and say that nothing happened that morning
            * Chapter 41
            * Luffy and Zoro eat bones
            * Kaya’s other butler gives up the ship he spent his free time designing and building to a bunch of pirates because his employer asked him to
            * It is revealed that Usopp actually lies because his mom died. This is like ‘wubalubadubdub’ from Rick & Morty but played straight
            * Kaya wants to become a doctor. I don’t know if that ever comes up
            * Chapter 42
            * Musician gag begins
            * Yosaku immediately recovers from scurvy after drinking lime juice. People say Luffy growing his teeth back are indicative that the toon fruit was always the plan
            * SBS: somebody asks about ‘ta-dah’ they are probably asking about the ‘don’. Oda felt the need to answer the question
            * Chapter 43
            * I’m pretty sure this was meant to be Arlong. That might be his nose  
            * Speaking of noses Usopp still has his triangular human-ish nose
            * Luffy deflects a cannonball and somehow hits the backside of Baratie
            * Lieutenant Fullbody apparently has a private stock of flies
            * Sanji’s eyebrow curls away from the center of his face but post time skip it swirls towards the center. So, both his eyebrows together would look like this: ؎؎
               * Chapter 44
               * I like that Patty tells customers ‘Enjoy your shit’
               * Sanji and Patty both seem to talk with Brooklyn accents




               * 4/6/22 Volume 6
               * Chapter 45
               * Gin tells Luffy about the horrors of the Grand Line. The same thing later happens with the New World. However, the Grand Line is mostly as bad as the regular world. Sure, there are sea kings in the Grand Line but there was a sea king outside of Luffy’s village
               * SBS: Django gets his powers from a magic mushroom
               * Chapter 46
               * Pg 6 Usopp’s nose has become less sharp
               * Don Krieg is apparently famous for going back on his word
               * SBS: Oda says he draws 3 weeks ahead
               * Chapter 47
               * Don Krieg has 5,000 men. Let’s remember that for later
               * Chapter 48
               * Zeff has a logbook of the Grand Line but it might actually be useless considering there are several different routes from Reverse Mountain
               * Chapter 49
               * Gin seems very out of place with the Krieg pirates. A lot of these early One Piece villains seem to rule with fear but later most crews are nakama. But the early crews still seem to be nakama among themselves, but not with their captain.
               * It’s weird to see Johnny and Yosaku swimming, after you’ve read a while you just forget most people can do that
               * Chapter 50
               * Luffy sends everyone but himself after Nami, despite the fact that that would leave him marooned, he can’t navigate, and has no idea where she is going
               * SBS: Oda really likes to conflate vikings and pirates for some reason
               * Chapter 51
               * Nu Alvida has appeared in the cover story
               * The paneling of all of Zoro’s memories makes it look like he is about to die
               * Chapter 52
               * The Strawhats split up in this chapter
               * Chapter 53
               * Krieg implies that Mihawk has a devil fruit, this might have been true at the time but has been replaced with haki
               * Krieg actually believes that Zeff knows where the One Piece is and didn’t take it for himself
               * I like that the chefs fight with giant cutlery
               * Sanji throws his first kick
               * 4/7/22 Volume 7
               * Chapter 54
               * When I was a kid, I didn’t have volume 6 and the intro doesn’t mention that Nami stole the Merry so I was completely lost when we eventually reached her again
               * Sanji balances on his hand to do a spinning kick, wouldn’t that put a lot of pressure on his hands that are ‘too precious to damage’
               * I wonder if this Pearl dude inspired Gaara
               * Chapter 55
               * I made the point earlier that Nami is shocked by the concept of brotherhood among pirates; interestingly the cover story shows the Buggy pirates having a tragic funeral for their, presumed dead, captain
               * Pearl can make fire by banging pearls together, he must be part Lunarian
               * Krieg uncaringly remarks that Pearl will burn the ship down. Currently his only other option for a ship has been split in half so not doing anything would strand them all at sea
               * The other Krieg pirates make it seem like Pearl’s fire is an involuntary defense mechanism but Pearl seems completely lucid and aware
               * Krieg keeps standing there like Jiren, as if this isn’t a life-or-death situation for him as much as for the Baratie crew
               * SBS: Oda says that Sanji’s eyebrows are because of rotational energy
               * Chapter 56
               * Do they ever explain how Sanji managed to get past the Red Line?
               * I get the dream of the All Blue and such, but don’t you need spices? Or non-fish or fruit
               * It’s smart to contrast how Sanji insisted on eating everything given in the present but threw away food like a normal person during the flashback
               * Chapter 57
               * Chapter 58
               * This SBS marks the second time somebody suggested Zoro mutilating Luffy as a special move
               * Chapter 59
               * The ship is still on fire, you figure a sea restaurant would have some sort of solution for this sort of thing
               * Luffy refuses to acknowledge the Baratie as Zeff or Sanji’s treasure
               * SBS: Oda characterizes a response from Luffy as ‘no mercy’
               * Chapter 60
               * Pg6 one dude on the left side of the middle panel has devil fruit hair
               * Kuro somehow made top ten in the first character poll
               * Chapter 61
               * Pg8 Gin has Luffy’s gear 4 flames in the background
               * Chapter 62
               * 4/8/22 Volume 8
               * Chapter 63
               * The volume cover shows Krieg, Gin, and Pearl but Gin and Pearl have already been removed from the battle
               * Luffy manages to punch Krieg through his armor. Interestingly this is one of the more possible attacks in the series, considering that people can still get broken ribs and internal bleeding through bullet proof vests and concussions can still happen through helmets
               * Luffy passes out from blood loss at the end of the Kuro fight but he seems to be losing a lot more blood here
               * Chapter 64
               * Kuina appears as the banner for the SBS
               * SBS: the penis question has appeared
               * Chapter 65
               * Zeff says ‘he who hesitates is buzzard food’. Binks’s Sake has not been introduced
               * Krieg has the gall to say he’s the world’s strongest man. I know East Blue is backwater but even someone as conceited as Krieg couldn’t be that ignorant of the rest of the world
               * I’ve noticed in these early Volumes the SBS only has one banner for the entire volume but later volumes have several. I wonder when that changes.
               * Chapter 66
               * SBS: Oda introduces the naval rankings
               * Chapter 67
               * Sanji gives orders to Carne and Patty like he owns the damn place
               * Chapter 68
               * Fishmen Island is first mentioned, we haven’t actually reached Arlong Park yet
               * Zeff: “Not a day goes by that I don’t regret saving your worthless life”
               * Chapter 69
               * Cover page shows some reindeer and Usopp’s nose is starting to become more cartoony
               * Zeff said some people call the Grand Line ‘Paradise’
               * Shichibukai are introduced, Mihawk is mentioned as one and Jinbe is also named
               * Luffy says the seven must be impressive but in my experience, I’ve mostly seen them lose
               * Yosaku mentions three great powers in the Grand Line, the shichibukai being one, he doesn’t actually say what the other two are. I assume the other two are the Yonko and the Marines but the Marines aren’t unique to the Grand Line and the Yonko aren’t typically in the part of the Grand Line he’s talking about
               * Captain Nezumi may be our first example of a custom laugh. Never mind Buggy actually has a custom laugh. Luffy still doesn’t ‘shishishi’
               * SBS: Oda states that Luffy is natural rubber, wouldn’t that make him a Logia?
               * Chapter 70
               * Ah yes, the old Swastika chapter. I remember when I first read this chapter, I was stunned to see it in anything and I thought, “wow these guys must be really evil,” and Arlong’s whole racism angle really didn’t help matters. I checked at the bookstore, the manji is still in print right now.
               * Usopp still has nostrils
               * SBS: The D. question has been asked, literally a thousand chapters later and it still hasn’t been answered
               * SBS: Oda answers a question about Rum and pirates
               * Chapter 71
               * Arlong says that Fishmen evolved from humans. I wonder if that’s true, if humans and fishman are the same species. I know Big Mom has a half fishman daughter so clearly the two cannot be that far apart genetically. But then again Big Mom has bred with every race under the sun so who knows what the requirements are
               * Also, nothing of Arlong so far has sold the slavery angle
               * I’m glad Zoro drowns himself just to fuck with Nami
               * 4/9/22 Volume 9
               * Chapter 72
               * Nami’s feet on the cover are bigger than her head
               * Arlong already blows Krieg and Kuro out of the water. The fact that he actually starts doing shit in his first few chapters, his use of sedition as an excuse to attack people, the hatred of humans, he’s set up so much better as a villain than anyone before him.
               * I doubt Oda had come up with the meaning at the time but seeing the Sun Pirates tattoo on Arlong’s chest is jarring
               * I like that Usopp used to claim he had millions of followers but after meeting Krieg he says he has thousands. He updated his lie based on something more realistic. Even though Krieg only had a hundred fighters with him.
               * Chapter 73
               * I’m not sure what changed, but Hachi doesn’t quite look like he does later on
               * Though this isn’t the first appearance of a sea monster this may be the first official Sea King in Moomoo
               * So, I found some fan translations to parallel the Viz translations and Viz has been censoring the SBS. Though I could still identify it, the Japanese version explicitly asks if Luffy’s penis can stretch, there are several references to poop that get changed, yet the blood and violence of One Piece that doesn’t get touched.
               * Chapter 74
               * >Bragging about a 20 mil bounty
               * Arlong’s hat is weird. It looks like a warm winter hat but if you ever got that thing wet it would be miserable to have on
               * Chapter 75
               * Arlong’s fishmen have a lot of tattoos but only he and Hachi have the Sun Pirates tattoo. And there is a wide variety of tattoos too. It's not like there’s only 3 being passed around in different combinations, there’s the Arlong tattoo, a crab, various kanji, the Manji, yakuza swirls. I wonder if the Sun Pirates were already planned since Jinbe and the island itself have already been mentioned.
               * Pg 18 bottom panel, a truly bizarre translation. Arlong talks like this in Japan but they don’t adjust the what speech bubble is where to make it more English friendly so now he looks like he was about to say something and was cut off
               * Chapter 76
               * Sanji has the balls to mock Zoro for losing to Mihawk, after minutes earlier getting a lecture on how Mihawk is one of the most dangerous men in the entire world
               * I believe this is the first Zoro Sanji Rivalry panel. It isn’t really a rivalry yet, Sanji’s just an uptight ass at this point. He had a similar argument with Usopp earlier.                                                                    
                  * Chapter 77
                  * Belle-Mere has the worst haircut I’ve ever seen in anything ever
                  * ‘I wish I had been found by rich people’ Nami’s insatiable greed predates Arlong
                  * This chapter was a flashback and then it had a flashback to Belle-mere and then another flashback to Noriko finding Nami.
                  * Chapter 78
                  * So, I don’t understand the financial side of Arlong’s plan. He collected around 25mil his first night but he’s willing to sell Nami the village for 100mil. It’s stated that Arlong collects monthly but he couldn’t be collecting as much as he did because then his profits would outpace Nami’s bid in 4 months.
                  * Chapter 79
                  * She raised a thief and a coward                                                                                           
                  * Genzo establishes that the Grand Line Navy is on a different level
                  * If you can just survive, good times will come. It isn’t exact but it’s a bit like Binks
                     * Chapter 80
                     * The tip of Usopp’s nose is rounded but he still has nostrils
                     * I know that Nezumi is just doing dirty work for Arlong but he actually has an excellent point. Just because Nami stole from pirates doesn’t mean that the items were clean, they belonged to someone and the pirates stole from them. That someone deserves to have their stuff back and Nami really isn’t any better than the original thieves
                     * Nami admits to stealing
                     * If Genzo knows, why couldn’t they quickly scrape together 7mil and pay Arlong off earlier in this arc. They were able to pay 25mil earlier and even if this bankrupts them for a few months, so what? They wouldn’t have to pay and if the Arlong pirates attack anyway nothing would have mattered.
                     * Wow, in the first hundred chapters the marines have done nothing to redeem themselves. In this arc alone they have been shown to be either corrupt or ineffectual. The marines were always meant to be antagonists but not bad guys.
                     * Arlong is one of the greatest villains in the whole series, shame he got retconned
                     * Chapter 81
                     * The blood-stained money is a bit on the nose
                     * Why does Oda always draw feet with the toes curled
                     * What a way to end a volume
                     * 4/10/22 Volume 10
                     * Chapter 82
                     * SBS: first time somebody else opens the SBS
                     * Chapter 83
                     * We begin the Koby/Helmeppo cover story
                     * Sanji is stated to be pretty strong for a human, Germa was always the plan guys
                     * Can’t Luffy just stretch his arm to some far-off building and try to pull himself out that way
                     * This is the first time we actually see a DF user go into the water. Luffy says he feels like he’s losing his energy
                     * Chapter 84
                     * Noriko was shot in the stomach and is running around just fine
                     * Fishman Karate is introduced and Ray-dude is a 40th degree
                     * Hachi proclaims himself to be the 2nd best swordsman on fishman island. Though that seems like a joke if someone was legitimately the 2nd best athlete in their country that'd be something to proclaim. I don’t remember much of the fishman island arc but if there is a best swordsman there that’s a worldbuilding point for Oda.
                     *  SBS: ‘In this world there are certain unyielding truths that you simply cannot avert your eyes from’ -Oda
                     * Chapter 85
                     * I think it’s very strange that the Marines wouldn’t arrest Helmeppo after all the shit he pulled.
                     * What is Arlong doing right now? He seems to have vanished as soon as he threw Luffy in the water
                     * Zoro looks just like Mihawk in this panel                                                 
                     * Genzo and Noriko appear to have a telepathic conversation
                     * Hachi and Zoro compare sword weights when a heavier sword would actually be weaker
                        * Chapter 86
                        * Ray-man reiterates that Sanji’s ability to take punishment is unusual for a human
                        * Arlong is just content to lounge in the rubble. There’re a lot of Jirens in early One Piece, its weird
                        * Sanji beats the fishman by breathing on him
                        * Chapter 87
                        * ‘I think everything will be okay’ hard cut to Usopp dead on the ground
                        * This is a good moment for Usopp, it's entirely internal and because he’s surrounded himself with better people to aspire towards.
                        * Usopp still has nostrils
                        * Also, the fights in this volume are going rather quick compared to later in the series. Zoro and Sanji only take about a chapter each for their fight
                        *  SBS: Somebody suggested Luffy vore his enemies
                        * Chapter 88
                        * Arlong displays the fishman karate water splash attack but doesn’t cite it as fishman karate
                        * Sanji says that Arlong is strong for a fishman which might explain how Usopp of all people is able to beat Lips with a toy hammer
                        * Arlong continues to be a great villain by spelling out Nami’s struggle in this arc in a natural way
                        * Luffy explains that he can’t be bothered to move his body and there’s even a little ‘don’ to accentuate it
                        * Chapter 89
                        * I’ve always found it very strange, Arlong explains here that DFs lose their abilities when underwater but yet Luffy can stretch. If Buggy were in two halves and then both halves were submerged would you be able to pull one out and then he operates normally?
                        * Chapter 90
                        * I’ve mentioned it before, I’ll mention it again, we have yet another crew of villain pirates that treat each other like family. Unlike Kuro and Krieg, Arlong actually returns the affection
                        * I know we have as of now returned to this style of combat but why wasn’t Luffy doing stuff like this for most of the series.  
                        * Luffy exemplifies Usopp by his ability to tell lies … as opposed to his accuracy
                        * Also found my first ‘shishishi’ at some point I’ll look back and see if I can find another
                        * Despite Arlong’s constant bitching about how fishman are better and despite the fact that he is dressing down Luffy directly, Arlong never says anything along the lines of ‘you think you're better than me?’ which would kind of be appropriate from his later perspective of ‘Fishman don’t deserve to be slaves to humans’ if he falsely accused Luffy of having a need to be better than fishmen.
                           * 4/11/22 Volume 11
                           * Chapter 91
                           * Garp is name dropped in the cover story
                           * They fight

                           * Chapter 92
                           * Garp’s first appearance, though he’s wearing a dog hat to hide his face
                           * How is Luffy stretching his fingers when they’re knit? The knitting makes sense because they can just be stretched into place but how he manages to spread them out when it’s clear his fingers aren’t holding on to each other is impossible. This must be proof that he was a Zoan the whole time
                           * Sanji says Arlong looks like a fishman gone berserk but he imagines a sea king. Could this be proof that the sea kings are in fact evolved fishmen, after all the mermaid princess rules over the sea kings as well
                           * Viz uses the sound effect they have been using to replace the ‘don’ for Arlong’s rage but it was a different sound effect in Japanese
                           * Again, Arlong comes very close to his retconned goals, he says that he will conquer the world. If he had said he would overthrow the world government or humanity it would have fit his later characterization
                           * Chapter 93
                           * Morgan gets a hit in on Garp while in handcuffs. It is very strange that the marines didn’t remove his ax when they captured him
                           * Arlong treats Nami like a pet and even tries to convince Luffy of what a great pet-owner he’ll be
                           * Arlong is easily the first threatening villain in the series but he comes off as slightly one-dimensional to me now, knowing how Oda tried to retroactively write him.
                           * If Arlong can tell when she’s drawing charts wrong, why does he need her in the first place? Moreover, how are they mapping underwater because Nami would be incapable of that
                           * Arlong’s nose was broken twice but it should have only been broken once and that used as the final shot of him for this arc
                           * Chapter 94
                           * I’m really annoyed that colored pages get lost to time. You can always tell when a page was originally colored and then monotonized because of its weird shading. Like I have ‘deluxe’ volumes of manga like Berserk that don’t have all their colored pages.
                           * Arlong’s nose-shaped flagstaff wasn’t also broken 2/10     
                           * Usopp no longer has nostrils
                           * Despite the fact that Nami no longer has a need for the money she still demands that Nezumi return the money that doesn’t belong to her in the first place. And as we are all aware her money angle becomes a running gag, so it is completely fair to say Nami is a greedy pirate
                           * Viz in their continued efforts to obscure everything great about the series mistranslate Sanji saying ‘he says you’ll get what you deserve’ into ‘he says something terrible will happen to you’

                           * Luffy’s bounty photo, but not his bounty, is added. Also, there isn’t a scene in this chapter of Usopp standing behind Luffy like he does in the picture, any time Usopp and Luffy are in the same panel Zoro and Sanji are closer than Usopp

                                 * Nami steps out of a changing room wearing Robin’s cowboy costume minus the hat
                                 * Though I joke about Tashigi being Kuina there’s literally no way she could be, she’d remember Zoro in this scene, and even if you believe the amnesia BS how would her body get away from Zoro. And really, I don’t think Kuina would be opposed to using a sword to make money considering her dad owns a dojo

                                 * Alvida is doing the Boa Hancock thing of having a sex-magic fruit and having everyone ogle her and wanting to fuck Luffy

                                 * Ya know, if I saw a pirate declare himself as the next king of the pirates where the previous king of the pirates was executed and then he survived his execution, I’d maybe think that God has deemed this man to be the king of the pirates. But that’s just me. And Sanji apparently
                                 * Alas the volume has ended, but so far we have only seen Paramecia fruits and Smoker hasn’t had his fruit revealed yet, just the fact that he has one. I’m pretty sure Smoker explains that his fruit is a Logia but it could have matched the properties of the other fruits just fine, the only difference being that because he’s made of smoke things just go through him like swords through a Buggy.
                                 * Also, Smoker was hyped a lot in these past two chapters but he has already failed
                                 * 4/12/22 Volume 12
                                 * Chapter 100
                                 * This is the first volume to drop the East Blue headline and instead uses Baroque Works
                                 * Dragon says that being a pirate is not a bad idea next to the inherited will quote. He is likely referring to Luffy after just having seen him declare himself king of the pirates. Since Dragon’s goal is to overthrow the government, he is likely saying that being a pirate king could also end up at that place. To my knowledge Roger and Dragon have never met
                                 * When I was a kid, the rain always confused me. Why aren’t the DF users affected by it? I later justified to myself that it must be because it isn’t seawater, only to later learn that fresh water works just as well but you need to be submerged. But having been in a few hurricanes in my life I can tell you heavy enough rain is basically being submerged
                                 * If Alvida has no friction, how does she even keep her clothes on, are they just floating a millimeter of her body?
                                 * So far, the only difference between Smoker and the other 3 is that he can produce smoke
                                 * Introduction of sea stone, though with Buggy and Alvida a regular net would have been enough if you could get it closed around them
                                 * Luffy’s arm doesn’t stretch when Sanji is trying to go back and defend Tashigi, either Oda’s a hack or Sanji’s heart wasn’t in it                
                                 * Some interesting stuff happens with Smoker, for one he picks Luffy up with smoke. I’m not sure how smoke could get thick enough to do that but it does. Assuming the smoke is thick then picking Luffy up isn’t a mistake, plenty of people have done that without haki. Smoker also turns into smoke when Sanji kicks him. This is interesting because, again, this wouldn’t contradict the other DFs we’ve seen at this point, his body has become smoke so it will dissipate if you try to touch it. However, it is later retconned with Crocodile that Logias have to transform consciously. The term Logia has also not been stated. And lastly Oda is really hyping Smoker up, shame he just disappears.
                                 * Smoker asks why Dragon would help Luffy. We, the audience, hundreds of chapters later, understand that it’s because Luffy’s his son. However, Smoker doesn’t know that, and since he knows Dragon opposes him, why would he even ask. Surely ‘the enemy of my enemy’ would immediately occur to Smoker, he would assume that Dragon was just trying to fuck over the government. Why would Smoker assume that Dragon would fight against a pirate?
                                 * Could Alvida even get wet? Surely since her skin is frictionless the water would just not touch her
                                 * Usopp’s nose is now full cartoon
                                 * With East Blue officially over I just want to praise how efficient it was. In the same span as Dressrosa we had 4 crewmates, 7 major locations, introductions to Devil Fruits, Fishman, the Grand Line, the Red Line, Shichibukai, the marines, Inherited Will, bounties, and probably more.

                                                * Don’t know why Viz decided to change Baroque’s motto to ‘mystery’ ‘secrecy’ makes a lot more sense and is way more intimidating
                                                * Viz also felt the need to explain that Igaram is his real name in the middle of a scene where it’s explained that people have infiltrated Baroque
                                                * I mentioned before that up until this point Devil Fruits have all followed the central rule of ‘turning the body into X’ but this is the point where that rule no longer applies. Ms. Valentine and Mr. 5 don’t actually break the rule but they are stretching it. Previously all DF users appeared normal until you interacted with their bodies in which case their bodies would react bizarrely. Valentine specifically can turn her power on and off which we haven’t yet seen. I know there’s some funny business with Logias coming up but at the moment Smoker still followed the initial rule. Mr. 5 creates a whole mess of problems because he'd technically be awakened. Mr. 5 can turn his boogers into bombs but I wouldn’t really count those as part of his body. By the same logic as the booger-bombs he should also be able to turn his piss into bombs.

It’s not like he was sick and cured and such, and it’s not like he stopped believing in Hiriluk. In fact, they had to throw a sudden line of doubt in 1 page before this scene.

                                                                              *                                                                                    * Chapter 163
                                                                                 * People make the comparison between Alabasta and Dressrosa, but Crocodile’s plan is way more subtle. Doffy’s plan was to force the king to attack his citizens which he did but the whole time the king was literally crying and telling people to run. I’m not sure what is considered common knowledge of Devil Fruits in the New World, but I think if you saw your king running around, begging to not attack people, you might think something is amiss. Doffy’s angle with Sugar’s powers also helped a lot. Croc, on the other hand, spent a decade slowly building himself up while subtly using his powers to affect the weather towards his ends. Everything would have worked out perfectly except for the fact that Robin didn’t want him to win. Could he have maneuvered around that, maybe I’ll decide once I’ve read it again, but Croc’s plan was pretty air tight. Another thing Doffy had that Croc didn’t was nakama. My point is that the two are often compared but their personalities, strategies, power levels, and goals are very different from one another and even though they both tried to take over a country, they really don’t parallel each other much
                                                                                 * I wonder if the name of Koza’s Sand-Sand group is foreshadowing. So far, it’s the only thing I’ve seen that isn’t directly related to a fruit with that double word naming convention
                                                                                 * Chapter 164
                                                                                 * Chapter 165
                                                                                 * I never really noticed that Usopp calls everyone else on the crew a monster: Zoro, Chopper, Luffy, Sanji
                                                                                 * So, what is an assassin exactly? Though the distinction isn’t used in One Piece the pirates of the world are obviously divided into Peacemains and Morganeers. All these assassins act really confused about Croc being their boss but he’s a textbook Morganeer and I don’t think assassins would have a problem with Morganeers. Ms. Double says she’s confused because he’s a Shichibukai but I figure the average assassin would be cynical enough to say, ‘the 7 are just in it for the money, as soon as something better happens, they’ll betray the government’. And I don’t think this is supposed to surprise the audience because we’ve known Croc’s a bad dude before we knew he was a shichibukai

                                                                                 * It’s amazing that Sanji avoided notice from Croc both times

There was a point in Alabasta where it rained rarely but evenly, if all the water was supposedly being siphoned to one place, wouldn’t that one place be flooded from overabundance?

                                                                                 * ‘Five flying devil fruits’ Obviously Pell counts himself among these 5, but what other 4 he was referring to I have no idea. Let’s make a rule where a devil fruit only flies if that is its obvious power. This rule excludes Doffy swinging from clouds or Ace rocketing himself. I think we could reasonably add Shiki, Marco and Morgans but after that you start to get unsure. It’s not as if Pell referred to the five bird Zoans; the literal translation is ‘flying powers’. I doubt he was referring to people we’ve seen up until now because the only two you could add are Smoker and Ace but then who are the other two? You could stretch it a little and say Buggy but that still leaves one slot open and nobody else flies. This line confused me so much it has stuck in my brain for over a decade and I still don’t have an answer

                                                                                                * Chapter 200
                                                                                                * Luffy declares himself the eighth warlord of the sea
                                                                                                * Luffy’s first transformation: Water Luffy
                                                                                                * Well, that was a pretty uneventful chapter overall but since we are now in the 200s I’d figure I’d do a quick recap of the last hundred. One Piece is still moving at a good pace, in the last hundred we’ve been to Reverse Mountain, Whisky Peak, Little Garden, Drum Island, and Alabasta. We learned about Raftel and a lot about the Grand Line. We’ve met a Shichibukai, Giants, a Roger pirate, the Rumbar pirates, Blackbeard pirates, Whitebeard pirates, Elbaf has been introduced, and this was all done in a little over 2 years. I think at the moment there aren’t Logia fruits, I think Oda is thinking of them as ‘trained paramecia’ more than their own thing. The term ‘Paramecia’ hasn’t been used either. And with this cover pages Cammy has already been introduced and sold into slavery foreshadowing
                                                                                                * Chapter 201
                                                                                                * I thought for a second that Croc had used awakened-tier powers
                                                                                                * Has Tashigi ever accomplished anything?
                                                                                                * Chapter 202
                                                                                                * Remember when Luffy had to employ strategy to defeat his opponents? You know, actually I think strategy is the exception not the rule. Arlong, Luffy was stronger and hit him really hard. Krieg, Luffy was stronger and hit him really hard. Buggy was actually defeated by tying his limbs together but that wasn’t Luffy’s idea. Wapol, Luffy hit really hard. Next, we have Jaya where the entire payoff is that Luffy only needs to hit the guy once to win. After that is Enel, which I don’t remember most of but I know Luffy didn’t even understand how he hard-countered Enel. Enel employed more strategy by restarting his own heart. I don’t want to go through everyone and I know there are some strategies later but I think Luffy punching hard is the most common win condition.                 
                                                                                                * Luffy purposefully missed with the water to revive himself from Croc’s attack
                                                                                                * Interesting that Luffy passes out from blood loss and is confused because the meat should have healed him. Just making a note of this incase it is ever stated that Luffy’s body works off JRPG logic and all his wounds will auto-heal when he eats enough random food
                                                                                                * First appearance of a Poneglyph
                                                                                                * Does Robin have to touch the Poneglyph to read them? I’ll try to keep track but I’m pretty sure she rubs her hands on them every time she reads one. God imagine if that was a requirement and that rubbing of Big Mom’s was completely useless

He should be running, not trying to kill Robin, she can’t reveal any more information than anyone else who’s there at this point since he had his big villain speech and told everyone his plan

                                                                                                * Chapter 209
                                                                                                * Chapter 210
                                                                                                * Chapter 211
                                                                                                * Since the narrator has called this the end of the conflict, I am now going to write my thoughts on Alabasta. We are now far from where we started and are into the ‘proper’ One Piece. The story is focused on the world and the people within it rather than gags and weirdness. Not that gags and weirdness are suddenly gone for good, Luffy did find Croc because a staircase looked ‘Crocodile-ish’. This was certainly the longest section of the story to date, as I was reviewing my notes to try and find an earlier mosshead gag I noticed Drum Island ended at about 150 meaning we’ve been in Alabasta for over fifty chapters. It didn’t really feel too long to me, the only part that felt like it dragged was when the Strawhats paired off against BW agents. Turns out I was wrong, Luffy did just hit Croc really hard, as soon as he could punch that’s the only thing he did. No explanation was given about the poison Luffy just tanked it. 1047 came out yesterday. In it, Kaido claims that Roger conquered the world using only Haki. Reading these old chapters, it is very obvious Haki wasn’t a thing yet so I wonder what, if anything, was the first explanation of Roger’s prowess. Maybe it’s like that mermaid thing from earlier in this volume where Oda had an idea and then adjusted it later on. Anyway, Alabasta also didn’t feel that long to me because I’ve been pacing myself to a volume a day so I don’t really get sick of what I’m reading. I’m not sure how that will hold up when we get to Dressrosa but for now its working pretty ok.
                                                                                                * Chapter 212
                                                                                                * I understand the WG position about who killed Croc, but wasn’t the whole idea behind the Shichibukai that they could turn pirates into heroes? Why would they be mad that pirates saved Alabasta when the Strawhats greatest crime up to this point was that their captain attacked a corrupt marine captain. I don’t think Wapol has filed a complaint yet, he hasn’t had his cover story
                                                                                                * And Smoker faced no consequences for insubordination

                                                                                                * Cobra tells Sanji where Vivi is bathing, knowing Sanji’s intention is to perv

                                                                                                * Also, Igaram claims admirals will be after Luffy but not really, there’s way higher bounties out there, and the only Admiral that goes after Luffy was Kizaru but that was in response to the Celestial Dragons not the bounty.
                                                                                                * Chapter 214
                                                                                                * Fullbody used to be a lieutenant, he really was demoted

                                                                                                * Chapter 217
                                                                                                * This volume ends the Baroque Works headline and switches to Skypiea instead
                                                                                                * SBS: some details on Marine uniforms
                                                                                                * Chapter 218
                                                                                                * So, the Poneglyph only had info on the weapon specs and location. I’ve heard a theory that since Poseidon can control the Sea Kings, the Pluton must be able to control land animals, and the Uranus controls sky creatures like dragons. I noticed many animals were fond of Vivi this past arc
                                                                                                * More importantly there is a huge info dump on Poneglyphs. First, they actually have normal names but Oda gave them special furigana pronunciations like with the ‘doping’ attack earlier. Poneglyphs are literally named ‘historical texts’ and the Rio Poneglyph is named ‘true historical text’. I actually thought that the Rio and Road Poneglyphs were the same until just now. Now I think the Rio Poneglyph must be on Raftel and part of the One Piece. Wonder why Oda named it ‘Rio’ Viz seems to think it’s a transliteration of ‘Real’ but I’m not sure. But the idea that it’s the Spanish word for river doesn’t make a ton of sense either
                                                                                                * Robin has her first ‘Just let me die’ moment and Luffy tells her to shut up
                                                                                                * Turns out this quote wasn’t by Louis Arnot, it was by Willy Gallon. How much you wanna bet he was the guy who invented DFs or some such nonsense
                                                                                                * I like this scene; it helps sell that there is still mystery and danger in the Grand Line even though we’ve now been in the Grand Line longer than East Blue. It bucks familiarity
                                                                                                * SBS: A viewer identifies Mr. 3 walking free in Alabasta, in fact he’s shown outside Rainsdish listening to Vivi’s speech

                                                                                                * Interesting that Robin knows about Sky-islands at all. I wonder where she learned about them from. Certainly not Croc his powers and outlook would completely clash with going to a sky-island ever

                                                                                                * Chapter 220
                                                                                                * This chapter is called, ‘a walk on the sea floor’ the cover story is called ‘Hachi’s walk on the seafloor’ clearly the One Piece is on the seafloor
                                                                                                * Chapter 221
                                                                                                * The size scaling in this double page is amazing.                                                                                                          * So, for any idiots out there who were wondering why people didn’t like the fact that Luffy had a Mythical Zoan the answer is this chapter right here. Up until this arc the only sub-categories of DFs were Zoans and everything else. This arc added both Logias and Paramecia and the first thing they said about Logias is that they are the strongest type. When Enel sees Luffy’s powers the first words out of his mouth are degrading, saying that Luffy has a lesser fruit because of its category. Luffy from there proves him wrong, not only is his fruit not weaker than Enel's, it's objectively better. Luffy then beats him, shattering Enel’s self-image as an ascendant being and sends him running to the moon.
                                                                                                         * The anime really didn’t do Enel’s face justice
                                                                                                         * Also, hate to put a damper on the moment, but just because something is an insulator doesn’t mean electricity will never go through it, that just means it takes significantly more electricity to go through. In other words, if you charged some rubber with, say, 100 million volts, it would still get shocked.

Do they need special training to time their strikes so that the cuts are uniform or do they take turns getting to execute the prisoner?

                                                                                                               * Chapter 300
                                                                                                               * Turns out there was a silhouette panel at the end of this arc but the one on 253 actually looks more like the final version. For comparison’s sake                                     253:   300:  1044:                                                              But the full moon was shown in this chapter but not 253
                                                                                                               * Hey look Sanji is already foreshadowing his time skip training                                
                                                                                                               *                                                                                                                  * So that’s another hundred, this was certainly a far better chapter than 200; however overall, I’d say the period of 100-200 was better than 200-300. There was only the wrap-up to Alabasta, Jaya and Skypiea. Jaya is a really excellent section, I think it’s actually a bit underrated because it’s so short, but it covers a lot of subjects very well and very quickly. And while the existence of Skypiea really expands the world with the idea that there is a whole other sea to be explored, Skypiea itself is really boring. It just looks like a beach. Sure, their society is fucked up and tyrannical but that feels like its only like that to get the plot moving towards Enel. Compare it to Dressrosa where the horribleness of the setting is explored thoroughly to the point where some members of the crew are helpless victims of it. Meanwhile in Skypiea the abducted crew members just leave to go looking around. Enel was a great villain, he was very intimidating, his omnipresence and absurd power level really made it feel like he deserved the title of God. Also in 200-300 were the introduction of the Paramecia and Logia types and honestly, I think they were a mistake. Already there are several fruits that break the rules. Luffy is made of natural rubber so by the definition of ‘things found in nature’ he should be a Logia. Bon Clay can change his whole body so by the definition of ‘control over their bodies’ he should be a Logia. Mr. 1 is basically metal which is just as natural as sand or lightning but because he can’t make holes for bullets to go through, I guess it doesn’t count. The story is still moving at a good pace though it has, again, been about two years for 100 chapters, but the number of things done is starting to slow down.

                                                                                                                  * Hey look another silhouette

One translation says that Roger followed its guidance which would lead them to Fishman Island. I think that is the most accurate given the rest of the story but the other two translations I have say that Roger will ‘guide this text’ and who even knows what that means. It’s not saying he will guide Poseidon; he’d be guiding the text. Robin comes to the conclusion that he means to put all the Poneglyphs together to tell the real history but that’s very obviously not what’s written. It’s not like Roger needs to speak vaguely so his enemies don’t find out his intent, the message is already encoded. He could just say “I’m going to combine these texts”

                                                                                                                        * Chapter 311
                                                                                                                        * I really don’t know why the Strawhats are acknowledging the rulings of the Foxes. If they didn’t play along the Foxes would either stop trying, try to guilt-trip them, or use force. If they stop trying, good. If they try to guilt-trip the Strawhats, they can just ignore it. If the Foxes try to use force there’s a good chance the Strawhats would win. The Strawhats are a powerful bunch and Foxy himself is very weak. His crew would probably drop their loyalty entirely if it came to violence since the only reason they're even on his crew is because somebody else lost a gambling match. The level of enthusiasm among the Foxes is actually really unrealistic. Yu Yu Hakusho had a really similar, and overall better arc with the Dark Tournament arc. The difference between this arc and that is that the crew in Yu Yu was literally in an entire world of demons so they couldn’t question the rulings. If they did and it turned to violence, they’d have to fight an entire world of demons who wanted them dead anyway, not just a shoddy crew of thieves and traitors.

                                                                                                                        * Chapter 312
                                                                                                                        * I hope I made it obvious that I don’t dislike comedy but this entire arc is making everything a gag and none of it lands at all. Right here Foxy orders a ‘Monster Burger’ and Oda draws everyone with funny faces but there literally isn’t a joke there it’s just a special move. Why are the Foxes terrified? This isn’t like when Kuro started flailing wildly, it’s just another special move that doesn’t even hit the audience. The other problem with making this entire arc a joke is that Foxy is the first villain to legitimately damage the Strawhats ever. After like, Kuro at the latest, the reader is aware that people don’t die in One Piece so nobody is in danger from violence. However, Foxy has not only made the Strawhats lose but has literally stolen a crewmate. This is literally the same reason Enes Lobby is top tier, because it’s a threat to the crew itself. But here Oda expects us to be laughing with Foxy as he slowly tears the crew apart by rigging all the games.

                                                                                                                                                   * Chapter 377
                                                                                                                                                   * Earlier today I was reading some threads and some people were bitching about how there’s random nobodies in Wano and that’s dragging the story down. You’d be hard pressed to find anyone who doesn’t consider Enes Lobby to be top tier. But right now, we are watching a fight of ‘random nobodies’ that being the Galley-La and the Franky House vs some idiot guards. Just going by chapter count these guys have been in the story way less than most people in the raid on Onigashima but I’ve never heard anybody complain that time is dedicated to them.
                                                                                                                                                   * One of the giants complains about how he doesn’t get enough sleep and that made me wonder how anyone could possibly sleep on Enes Lobby. Leaving light at a constant level for days on end is a real-life form of torture
                                                                                                                                                   * There was an advertisement for other volumes at the end of this chapter so I want to take this time to talk about releases. At the time of this chapter’s actual release, it was August 2005, at the time of this volume’s Japanese release it was November 2005. When viz released this volume in English it was April 2010. From about 2003 – 2009 Viz only released like 4 volumes a year of One Piece and only covered up to Alabasta. However, on January 5 2010 they released 4 volumes at once, and then another 5 in Feb 2010, and then 5 in March, 5 more in April, you get the point. Basically 30 volumes of One Piece were released in 2010 alone, they didn’t catch up, and the translations still suck. I thought this might have something to do with 4kids but likely not, the only connection that exists is that 4kids ended right before Jaya and the acceleration happened right before Jaya. My best guess is that Marineford was happening so somebody was like, ‘hey maybe we should get on this; turns out this story isn’t just about desserts and clouds’

                                                                                                                                                   * So, this is probably the most important chapter regarding DFs in the entire series.
                                                                                                                                                   * First of all, CP-9 is talking with obvious authority that 2 DFs on one person have been tested and that kills them. People have suggested using Blackbeard as evidence that people can have 2 DFs; it's just government propaganda that they can’t. CP-9 I figure would have some insider knowledge above the propaganda so I’m going to say 2 DFs is still against the rules for the average person.
                                                                                                                                                   * Next the idea of ‘Devils in the fruits’. First time I read it I thought that when Bruno admonishes Jabra for ‘believing rumors’ he meant that the rumor was that there was a devil inside the fruit. However, when Bruno is explaining how things work, he specifically mentions that what scientists understand is the ‘transmission of powers’. This makes sense given the Zoan-weapons but also doesn’t contradict the idea that there are devils in the fruits. Spandam (an incredibly sound-minded and reliable man) also states ‘I don’t know what sort of devils are within these fruits’ implying their presence.
                                                                                                                                                   * Lucci also kind of implies that the ‘curse’ of the DFs would magnify the more you had. If that’s referring to the water weakness I wonder if Blackbeard can even drink without going into a coma
                                                                                                                                                   * This is one of Viz’s more famous fuck-up translations. The way it’s stated in Viz implies that simply by eating the fruit you learn its name but I have two other translations that imply the fruit is named after the powers. Also, the DF Encyclopedia is mentioned
                                                                                                                                                   * Kaku says he feels ‘a strange power, like gravity’ coming from the fruit. I wonder if DFs pick people, the Nika fruit might have chosen its user. Who knows? I thought of that because Kaku really likes his fruit so maybe they were meant to be or something. He also implies DFs are natural
                                                                                                                                                   * Kaku actually peels his DF. Makes sense it is a banana
                                                                                                                                                   * They sense no immediate change; I wonder how most DF users discover their power. When Sabo ate his he already knew how it was supposed to be used so he did it instantaneously but Luffy had to learn through random circumstance showing how his powers work

                                                                                                                                                            * So, Saul’s last name, Jaguar, is spelled Haguwāru in Japanese. Most of it sounds like Jaguar but that H is definitely pronounced the way you expect. It’s like they were reading the word with the Spanish J like jalapeño. It must be intentional because there is a way to pronounce the J correctly in Japanese: ジャ. Here throw these in to google translate and see which sounds more like Jaguar                         ジャグワール or ハグワール

                                                                                                                                                            * Chapter 398
                                                                                                                                                            * SBS: The question of DFs and water. Oda is wrong, he declares any pool of water to be ‘the sea’. That’s wrong, the chemical makeup of the sea is different from rivers and lakes. This also throws a wrench into the mechanics of Seastone since just one touch is enough to drain all energy. Unless, like right now with Robin, you need them to walk around and emote in which case it just turns their powers off. Also, this answer came from a question about Crocodile’s bathing habits. Oda says Croc would shower but if he showers his sand could get washed down the drain so I think he uses a wooden tub that you have to empty by tipping it
                                                                                                                                                            * Chapter 399
                                                                                                                                                            * Being a ship technician myself, I know there’s no way you could tell if a blueprint would produce a functional ship just by flipping through it. But hey, good use of the characters you have there to prove that Franky’s telling the truth
                                                                                                                                                            * I’m going to do my hundred-chapter recap now because I don’t want to do it right at the start tomorrow. First of all, release is slowing down a little. Not much though, these hundred were over 2.25 years as opposed to the previous 2. 300-400 was the best section yet, Water 7 and Enes Lobby deserve the hype but if you’re looking for unbridled praise look somewhere else. 300-400 actually managed to cover more ground than 200-300 going to Long Ring Long Land, Water 7 and Enes Lobby (and Ohara if you wanna cheat). However, the villains kind of suck in this section. CP-9 is a bunch of goofy weirdos with their leader being the most serious, stick-up-his-ass edgelord I’ve ever seen. I’m not really against goofy weirdos or edgelords but I think that edgelords are a bit inappropriate for One Piece and I think goofy weirdos are a bit inappropriate for the CIA. I think Kaku should have been the leader of CP-9. He’s a little goofy but takes himself seriously enough so that he seems like an assassin with that politeness that makes it seem like the marines are supposed to be the good guys. Foxy on the other hand was something else. I had been reading for a while now what I thought to be shitposts; people actually praising Foxy and the Davy Back Fight. They were kind of right. Like I said earlier, the Foxy pirates were the first legitimate threat the Strawhats faced. But again, with Foxy it really seems like the reader is supposed to be laughing with him but it’s kind of hard to laugh when you see everyone you care about being ripped apart. In terms of overarching story however there were major reveals right at the end with the functionality of DFs and the Ancient Kingdom. After reading those DF pages again I was actually really excited to get to Robin’s flashback to see how much I missed but it really felt like squeezing blood from a stone.

                                                                                                                                                            * Chapter 416
                                                                                                                                                            * Does the bandana give him strength or something? Or does he just wait until he’s ready to finish to put it on? I swear Zoro has never won a fight without the bandana. Kaku sharing my thoughts. I wrote this on the page before Kaku talked
                                                                                                                                                            * Zoro was trying to use the steel-cutting technique but it didn’t work because Kaku wasn’t using the iron-body technique. First of all, it didn’t work because Zoro was on the wrong frequency, he was on the iron frequency when he should have been on the flesh frequency. Second, I guess the iron-body technique literally turns your body to iron. Third, Kaku knew how to recognize the technique and how to respond.

                                                                                                                                                                                          * SBS: I didn’t even know this thing existed until now but one of the random captains from Enes Lobby had a DF called the Beri-Beri Fruit which breaks so many rules. First of all, it’s specifically grapes the user turns into, not spheres or balloons, grapes. He can’t be hurt by blunt attacks but anyone can crush a grape and all of his grapes can fly once he transforms. Second, it’s classed as a Paramecia but grapes are found in nature and he can fully change the shape of his body so he meets both criteria for a Logia. Third (and the scope of this problem is small), shouldn’t plant-based DF’s get their own category since there’s one dedicated to animals? Does he taste like grapes?
