                                                                                                                                                                                                * Bounties: So Luffy has 300 mil and Gecko has 320 mil. In the grand scheme of things where there are billion bounties out there these two are basically equivalent. The difference being that since bounties are directly tied to crimes against the government Luffy’s is actually inflated compared to Moria’s. Moria is a Warlord, so he couldn’t have done anything like invading a major government base, burning the flag and killing the inhabitants. Luffy has committed two major crimes against the government: Revealing the Croc as a fraud and invading Enes Lobby so his bounty reflects that. Moria’s must reflect how difficult he is to capture alone, since he couldn’t have committed any major crimes or the government wouldn’t have hired him

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * Chapter 488
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * Yorki may have escaped the Grand Line
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * I give Viz a lot of shit, rightfully, but they actually managed to do a pretty good job translating Binks’s Sake, the only parts they missed are ‘with a don’ and ‘funny traveling tale’ but even the traveling tale part they tried to fit in. They also managed to make it rhyme and pace like the original so you could sing it in English. The anime was made years before their translation was released so they could have listened to it and made it match
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * The episode with the song in it is literally named, "Binks' Sake - The Song that Connects the Past and Present" in case you doubted the song’s importance
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * But what is the song actually about? Well, pirates for one. We can say that definitively since they say so themselves and it’s a song sung by pirates. What is Binks’s Sake? I’ve heard theories from literal sake, to laughter, to technological innovation. Personally, I think it's adventure or a stand-in for whatever excuse a pirate uses to send themselves out to sea to find adventure. After all, they're leaving their hometown to become pirates. I think the sun-moon-dawn metaphor is pretty obvious, out there in the world bad things will happen and things will become dark but there will be that beacon of light in the sky to remind you that things can get better. The ‘lose your nerve’ thing is really obvious in the context of this story since determination is the deciding factor in all fights.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * More recently this song is showing connection to the void century. Of course, the song calls itself a ‘funny traveling tale’ and we know Raftel’s real name is Laugh Tale, named after the story that was found there. That connects it to Joyboy so when Joyboy returned and the elephant started talking about the ‘drums of liberation’ that of course connects to the lines about drums in this song. Luffy at that time literally says he’ll turn to bones eventually, another line from this song.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * The line about people turning to bones I think has several meanings. First, I think it is about adventure again, a sort of you-only-live-once kind of thing. Second, I think it’s the idea that people eventually disappear tying into the mad doctor’s idea that people only die when they’re forgotten. Third, I think it also means that no matter who you are, you will die, even if you’re rich and powerful.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * I wonder if there is anything important about the pirate in this song coming from a village of weavers

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * So, Thriller Bark was an arc. It’s definitely not as strong as most arcs before it, I’d even call it generic. Moria does have interesting character traits but they aren’t really expanded on properly. The arc is also very quick which isn’t a bad thing. The final fight with Moria was really flaccid, he basically OD-ed on shadows and then gave up, it was pretty lame. While the emotional moments, ‘nothing happened’ and ‘Binks’s Sake’ were really good they didn’t feel like part of the story of Thriller Bark itself. ‘Nothing happened’ has the problem of being caused by another character that came in at the last minute, and ‘Binks’s Sake’ has the problem of being part of the overall story.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * I’ll start with the release speed, it’s about the same as last time, 2 years 3 months. In the big overarching plot, we have the first official appearance of a Roger Pirate, we also had set-up for Marineford and Wano of all things. Yonko were introduced, Haki was introduced, Luffy’s lineage. Luffy was always related to Garp that much I’m sure of since Oda did a prototype where Garp was still Luffy’s grandfather. Enes Lobby is of course great and it takes up 40% of this section. Thriller Bark was ok, I kind of feel like Oda was trying to rush it out the door so he could move on to what I’ll call, ‘the dark side of the world government’ saga, which is everything from here until the time skip. But back to 400-500, the Villains just sucked this time around, Moria wasn’t explored nearly enough and I’ve already complained about CP-9 in the 300-400 section. I guess you could count the CDs as villains, and while they’re good they’ve only been on screen for like 10 panels. Binks’s Sake was also in this section, and while it doesn’t come up again anytime soon, everything surrounding it is screaming how important it is. If I were to rank the sections so far, it’d be 300-400, 0-100, 200-300, 100-200, 400-500

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         * Anyway, how do you even talk about everything leading up to the time skip? There was so much more in pre than post and post really hasn’t hit the emotional highs of pre. The closest it came was Whole Cake Island but nothing else reaches that level. One thing post is good at is lore but considering it's slightly more than nothing vs nothing I wouldn’t say that’s saying much. Don’t misunderstand, I don’t hate the post time skip but comparing it to pre it just comes out lacking. Pre has East Blue, Alabasta, Skypiea, Enes Lobby, and the war as its major arcs and post only has Fishman, Kaido, and Big Mom and even then, Big Mom is a side quest in Kaido.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * So, 500-600 for real. I really wasn’t joking when I said this is the best part but there are a lot of important reasons why. The big one is that everything that happens in this section is part of a continuous story with one goal which Luffy keeps progressing towards. Every location he goes to serves the story, every villain he fights is intimidating, every ally he makes is interesting, new powers are introduced, new lore is introduced, the villain finally makes his debut. I think it’s completely fair to call this section the peak of One Piece.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   * Anyway, Fishman Island. Kind of boring, I heard someone recently say that once more is revealed about the story fishman island will look better in hindsight. No. The only thing that hasn’t been paid off yet is Luffy destroying the place, we’ve expanded on everything else: Joyboy, Big Mom, Luffy’s Territory, Fishman on the surface. What I’m really disappointed about is that there is no indication of Nika anywhere despite Who’s-Who saying he was a Fishman deity. They could have just had a little statue in the plaza and said, ‘this is our God whose name we forget but he was fun and just and loved everyone equally’. They had a little idol in Skypiea Oda could have done something like that. Hody was a terrible villain. People like that, people angry on behalf of others, aren’t typically vengeful; they're apathetic. They would let something bad happen to people they don’t like, they’re too cowardly to do anything themselves. Hody also was physically really weak and was propping himself up on the legacy of a much better villain which he retroactively ruined. And also, the energy steroids. The arc really existed to show just how cool and strong the Strawhats were after two years so it really wasn’t the best place to talk about the horrors of racism.  One thing I will applaud Oda for is the even-handedness of it all.  There were very fine people in both species, and I’m not talking about the New Fishman Pirates or the Celestial Dragons who should be condemned totally.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * Vegapunk’s office is in disrepair during the flashback but it's fine when Caesar is there. That’s less than 10 days between those events. Did Caesar repair the place for the show just now?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * It’s real cruel of that girl to talk about wanting to see her parents again when Momo’s were killed in front of him
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  * I wonder a lot about Vegapunk’s fruit here. First, the pattern is wrong. What does that mean? The fruit ends up working just fine so why does it have a different pattern? Second, why is it even here? Yes, obviously Vega made it on Punk Hazard and that’s why it’s there but why didn’t he take it with him? The way the exposition comes out later on makes it seem like Vega only told the WG it was a failure to keep them from hounding him about more. But if that were really the case it would be too valuable to leave behind. It would make sense to leave it if it was a failure. But it’s definitely not a failure because Momo eventually does all the same stuff Kaido does. Does Vega think it’s a failure? Seems a little out of character for the genius with a brain 500 years ahead of modern technology. How does he even test it? The fruit is completely intact and Momo gets a power out of it so Vega couldn’t have tested conveying the power. Was Vega making dragons to try and create a new dragon fruit? That doesn’t make any sense either because Momo’s dragon doesn’t look like the Vegapunk dragons at all. Third, and this applies to all artificial fruits, are they weak to water? Surely if Vega was making these things from scratch, he’d go out of the way to remove their one weakness. Evidence from the flooding of Onigashima shows that Smiles are still weak to water. But why? It just seems like the kind of design flaw that you’d try to avoid. Does S.A.D. turn into Lactic Acid when it touches water?

Doffy is in his 40s and Sugar (without the powers) is in her 20s.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 757
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * The scene with Rebecca being killed in the same way her mother was but Kyros being able to save her this time feels really contrived
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 758
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Usopp needs more moments like this, where his sniping saves the day. Funny thing is, with this as a precedent he could literally be anywhere and hit anyone and it would look good for him.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * ‘final’ battle
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 759
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Spikes lies to the rank and file and says they would have been un-toyed after the battle but then says to himself that they would have forgotten they exist. Can Sugar not un-toy people at will? Sugar knows she makes toys out of people so why couldn’t she just un-toy them without knowing who’s inside?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * SBS: Tontattas live to be 150 probably. They live slightly longer than humans. I speculated way earlier that humans live longer in one piece and I’m not sure I’m wrong
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 760
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Before this arc the longest arc was Skypiea with 66 chapters, if this was the final battle it would be a good finisher.

Can’t wait for 1053
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 761
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * This is the second time, along with the Ancient Kingdom’s name, that the mere existence of something would be enough to throw the world into turmoil. This means that everyone in the world already knows what these two things are but they believe they don’t exist for whatever reason. And it also seems that this is guarded knowledge even among the CDs
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Doffy cites the body-swap as a useful ability, and while I’d agree this hardly seems like the best ability Law has shown yet.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Doffy says he needed the fruit to use the national treasure and he brings up the body-switching, does that mean the treasure is a body or person?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * In general, I’m not aware of any surgery that puts the surgeon’s life at risk. I’ve seen people say that the surgeon grafts their lifespan onto another but if they could do that why not take a random person’s lifespan and graft that? Not to mention that would only double the patient’s lifespan not make them immortal
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 762
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * While Law obviously got a shit hand, I don’t see how he can turn this into hating everyone and not just hating the World Government for supporting the destruction of his homeland. Like his seems like a backstory for joining the Revolutionary Army. Not like Doffy where everyone met him with aggression so he returned it.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 763
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Doffy uses his CoC on the crowd. I bring it up because even a small child has a CoC that can knock out a crowd full of righteous anger towards evil people
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * The CDs actually call themselves dragons instead of humans. Very strange since they don’t have wings, claws or breathe fire. This might be a mistranslation
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * They have chips that identify them as CDs. I don’t think I’ve seen a single computer in all of One Piece so what the hell kind of chips are these, flattened dried snails?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Donquixote Homing just wants to live a quiet life
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * In a way it’s Doffy’s fault. Homing and his wife could have passed as normal people but Doffy had to scream his head off about why people weren’t bowing to him.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Everyone always talks about the D. conversation in this scene but I’m more interested in the Water part of his name because he doesn’t tell that to most people either and it is unique among the D.’s
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Fanscan claims Water is his mother’s name but I haven’t seen that elsewhere
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Law is the only D. in the story (that we know of) who hides his D. most wear it openly. Saul didn’t even know why he had it.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Viz calls D. an alias but everyone else calls it a secret name. I can see why you’d apply alias to that but I think secret name might have been the intention.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 764
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Rosa talks about how in his homeland (Mary Geoise) people treat the D.s like boogeymen. In other words, it isn’t the Celestial Dragons but somebody else who calls them God’s enemy.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Rosa goes on to say that the D.s and CDs are pitted against each other. However, and he should understand this first hand, only the Celestial Dragons consider themselves gods everyone else thinks they’re assholes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * And then the Grand Fleet did nothing
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Anyway, chapter 700-800 better known as Dressrosa. It was certainly better than I remember, but granted I read it over the course of two years the first time, 2 years 5 months and 18 days to be exact. This time I read it over about 10 days which would have been 1 or 2 chapters live. I did feel a little fatigued about it when all the officers were pairing of with the then future grand fleet captains but not nearly as fatigued as I felt in parts of Skypiea. Obviously, considering this entire block is on one island, the pace has slowed to a crawl. It picks up for the next section but then it crashes even harder in Wano. And by then we’re caught up so I think that’s everything I have to say about pace for the rest of my notes. Doffy is my favorite villain, I think he’s the best in the series. He is dangerous and intimidating plus he has major connections everywhere in the world. He also reveals a lot of lore while keeping that pompous CD attitude that makes them so hate-able. Dressrosa itself was a cool location with the toys and the stabby women and the colosseum. But by, like, 45% through that was all gone and it was just Birdcage and rubble so… Oh yeah, Sabo, what the hell was Oda thinking? Honestly his character has served no purpose and it seems he only exists to bring Ace back. And currently he’s dead again. I don’t actually believe he's dead because I think even the worst writers of the world would know better than to kill a character off, bring them back years later to do nothing and then kill them off again. Typically in that middle part they’d do something cool or impart some wisdom. But Sabo exists to do nothing, it's not even like he helped Luffy after his brother died or saved him from some battle he couldn’t have won otherwise. Whatever. Speaking of whatever, the Grand Fleet now exists.

Great work guys
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               * I’ve seen a lot of debate on how these coordinates work so I guess it’s up to me to settle it. The premise is that we have four rocks each of which has instructions to get somewhere. Those four somewheres, when aligned, will have a convergence point at Raftel. What people argue about is whether or not you actually need all four Poneglyphs to make it to Raftel. Obviously, you can’t do this with just one because you don’t have any context so you’d just end up searching the entire world like you already are. I’ve also never seen anyone arguing that few. People typically start at two. Assuming that the coordinates are (x, y) like they’re depicted here                                                                     then you actually could pull this stunt off with two Poneglyphs if you were lucky. If you manage to get these two                                                                                                                 then yes you could find Raftel. However, if you found these two                                                    or these two                                                                                                           you would have difficulty finding anything. I’ve seen it suggested that if you got two of the off-center coordinates you could sweep up and down until you hit Raftel.                                                                                                                                                 While that is true mathematically, you’d have to travel from Calm Belt to Calm Belt on each wrong pass. And in the Grand Line you can’t just sail aimlessly like that, you’ll get lost. There’s no real way to know your location on empty sea, all navigation is based on islands. If you had three points and (x, y) coordinates then you could find Raftel with 3 more easily. While you are guaranteed a convergence, because you don’t know where the fourth point is you won’t actually know where that convergence is. This leads to many of the same problems as the two-points solution, mainly that if you connect them wrong, you’ll just be wandering the ocean again.                                                                                                                          But you can actually get around this by creating a triangle and then sailing along each edge until you reach Raftel.                                                                                                                                     This actually avoids the problem of traveling aimlessly in hostile waters because you could use Eternal Poses to navigate to the islands and no matter which order you pick as long as you go along all three edges, you’ll hit Raftel. However, there is an even bigger problem. These projections are assuming that the coordinates are flat but the Grand Line has islands above the sky and beneath the ocean so there is a very real possibility that these are (x, y, z) coordinates. In (x, y, z) two-points is fucked, you might as well search the entire world. Three-points is slightly less than fucked, you can manage to pull a convergence out of the three locations                                                                                                                                                                         but good luck because now you have to explore the skies and trenches as well and you can no longer sail along the triangle. The other problem with the (x, y, z) coordinates is that even with the fourth coordinate you’d have the same problem that the third coordinate in the previous picture had, where the convergence isn’t guaranteed. The triangle method would still work; since you have 3-axises, two points must share an axis otherwise there’d be no convergence.                                                                                                                                                                                                     Only problem is now you have even more routes to deal with. Believe it or not the math can get even worse. Another legitimate possibility is that the coordinates are (t, x, y, z), in other words time travel. Now I don’t actually believe this one is going to happen I’m just saying that it’s a possibility; Toki is a character in the story and she did travel over 800 years. While this does have all the same problems as two-points on (x, y) and three-points on (x, y, z) you can still have a 4th-dimensional convergence. Except now you have to search, the sky, the seas, the floor, the past and the future. Again, I don’t believe this will happen. I'm just saying it’s possible to create a four-points (t, x, y, z) convergence. But since Nami says she can draw a map; I have a feeling time travel won’t happen. Anyway, back to One Piece
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               * PS: I’m writing this bullet during volume 86. It occurred to me that by drawing the charts on grids it looks easier than it would be to find a convergence. The reason this happens is because grids have an additional implicit coordinate of 0 making a two-points method technically three-points, three-points four, etc. In the story the Strawhats are unlikely to have the 0 coordinate and my math is based on that assumption.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Chapter 858
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * It was the giant who made the first move on Lola.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             * Luffy drinks milk to regrow a tooth. This is one of the few things that actually makes more sense with the Nika fruit. However, this is actually Brook’s ability. Brook did the milk-drinking-bone-growth thing way back in Chapter 475. I guess this still kind of makes sense with the Nika AOE theory but it doesn’t restore the crack in Brook’s forehead. That’s a battle scar from when he was alive and, I think, he had it before his Devil Fruit. He had that scar before he entered the Grand Line, I checked. It’s unclear when he ate his fruit, but the crew knew it was the Revive-Revive fruit so I doubt they would have given it to anyone but their captain and their captain was dying for a while there. I bring this up because comical BS may be intrinsic to DFs and that DFs can restore the body back to when it was eaten. Consider this: whatever the ‘devils’ are can morph a random fruit into the exact copy of another swirly magical fruit. Why couldn’t it morph a person? Logia fruits already have the ability to restore a user’s body after disintegration, why can’t other fruits do this? In a way Zoans have this ability too since the user is able to turn back to their original form from whatever they turn into. This bullet point is mostly speculation, I just think its weird that they share this ability and my AOE theory really doesn’t explain the first time it happens

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                * It really only bears mentioning because of the rewriting of history, but like I said with my last bullet there are people out there who weren’t around to see this shit live. When Katakuri was originally introduced he was said to have a Logia. This wasn’t characters misunderstanding his powers, this was Oda’s mistake and it is corrected in all further media to be a ‘special Paramecia’. Mind you, it wasn’t that it was stated once like a spelling error and no one caught it, they called it a Logia more than once. Apparently, this is because it was originally meant to be a flour-flour Logia but was changed during development to mochi. Rubber is more natural than flour, you have to process grain for flour

I assumed she was catholic because of the clothes and the mention of God in her first appearance but now she’s saying the Sun God worked a miracle?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    * Assuming the sun god they worship is Nika (though I doubt it) none of Luffy’s powers seem to line up with what Caramel pulled off. Think about some other mythical creature, a dragon for example: we know that they can fly, breathe fire and control the winds and look really cool. Since we’ve seen other mythical creatures appropriately depicted in their Devil Fruits, shouldn’t the lore of Elbaf’s sun god be reflected in Luffy’s fruit? I can’t really see what sort of rubber-hose logic could bring a fire to life and stop a town from burning. So why would they believe this was a miracle from the sun god if Sun God Nika is defined by goofiness and rubber?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   * This is exactly the sentiment I’m questioning                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   * Binks’s Sake is mentioned. I think this is the first time it’s brought up since its original appearance. Actually, Brook sings it to the whales when they leave fishman island, but this is the first time any other crew of pirates knows this alleged pirate song

I was going to say that because Big Mom saw Caramel use the soul fruit to create Pandora, because she created Prometheus, she must understand that she’s using the Soul fruit. Unfortunately, that isn’t the case so maybe she really does believe Caramel disappeared.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        * Chapter 900
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        * I happened to see that Oven’s beard is colored like this                             which reminds me of this                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Just sayin’
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        * I can’t believe the Strawhats are dead
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        * Chapters 800-900 were very good. Zou dragged in a few paces but it also revealed a lot in other places. Whole Cake wasn’t exactly consequential to the story but it was always really engaging to read. Big Mom, in this arc, feels like way more of a threat than she or even Kaido feels like in the next arc. Since the point of this arc was more of a heist than a conquest Big Mom had the privilege of being unbeatable which allows her to be very threatening. She captures everyone on the Strawhats side at one point or another and even takes out one of them. Granted, I felt nothing when Pedro died; he really didn’t have the screen presence of even Carrot so I wasn’t invested. It really feels like Big Mom is an empress, Kaido really doesn’t feel like that. He feels like any other pirate crew that set up in a country. Meanwhile Big Mom had islands and islands of subjects, a system of governance, unique laws, tangible goals, and a royal family. Kaido has a big skull, what is he a bokoblin? I really hope Wano isn’t over. Both Dressrosa and Whole Cake Island were better than I remember reading live, I really hope Wano will be better on Thursday because what we have now was really anti-climactic. Also, Katakuri was cool

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                * Wano Act 2 Starto
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                * Oh yeah, the tanooki pot. When I was a kid, I always assumed that the barrel of that bazooka was kind of like a mouth so they just shoved a Devil Fruit into it and that’s how Lassoo was made. Of course, that didn’t make sense with Funkfreed, so Vegapunk must infuse the essence of a fruit into whatever he’s using somehow. So how did this teapot get the tanooki fruit? They couldn’t have used Vegapunk’s method for a variety of reasons. Maybe it really was the Lassoo method and somebody put the fruit in the teapot for storage and then the teapot came to life. Maybe it is gastric acid specifically that brings out the powers and somebody vomited on the teapot while there was a fruit on it.

That reminds me of a theory I heard a very long time ago about DFs. When somebody finds one, they can usually tell its intrinsic value just because of how weird it looks. So, DFs will typically sit out for long periods of time before they’re eaten. In other words, most DFs are just rotten fruit with powers in them

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 * Blackbeard doesn’t sleep, I’ve heard all sorts of theories on this and I believe none of them. There was a mention in Chapter 134 (Drum Island) that there was a group of people in a snow country somewhere in the world that don’t sleep because if they sleep they’ll die. That’s literally all the information given but where Blackbeard was found didn’t look very snowy to me.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 * I think this is the first mention of Lodestar Island but the Wiki is unhelpful. Recently Jump has been printing little info booklets instead of chapters and the first one actually tied Lodestar Island to the Road Poneglyphs. The translators actually started calling them Lode Poneglyphs as Lode and Road are spelled identically in Japanese and Lode in this context means ‘a guide point for a ship’.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 * Roger ‘realized’ not ‘learned’.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 * It doesn’t actually explain anywhere that Lodestar Island is what reveals the existence of Red Poneglyphs. They reached Lodestar before God Valley; Big Mom had a Red Poneglyph already at this point
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 * Roger and Luffy share a hidden dream. I don’t think it's to be king of the pirates. I also don’t think it's to throw the world’s greatest party or make sure everyone can eat well. I don’t know what it is but none of those sound right to me. Frankly, I’d believe he said “I’ll achieve world peace” a more believable dream. I also just don’t really get why people are interested in this one. Its purpose is to link Luffy and Roger’s wills but we already have a dozen or so examples of this and there are way more interesting mysteries in the story.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            *                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               * I can say, without exaggeration, that I checked every fucking chapter of this manga and I found no evidence of Nika anywhere. Yes, Luffy hits the pose of Nika’s silhouette in Skypiea but so does Brook in Fishman Island and the G-5 Marines on Punk Hazard. There’s a whole bunch of other circumstantial evidence like “I’m not a Zoan” but the bottom line is there was never any reference to a character named Nika who was a god of sunlight and freedom. There was a sun god on Skypiea but it was a giant snake and was probably about prosperity and health. Fishman Island, where you’d expect to hear some legends passed between slaves, had no references. When Camie was put in chains, she didn’t pray to the sun god. I really hate to say this but Nika was an ass-pull. The character was introduced a mere 25 chapters before its reveal, which in any other manga would be a huge distance between set-up and payoff, but in One Piece is pathetically small. Compare that count to when Jinbe was first mentioned and when he appeared, 459 chapters.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * Who’s-Who reasoning that because the Sun Pirates were full of slaves is actually a completely reasonable question. And yes, fishmen have a history of slavery that’s why Jinbe joined the Sun Pirates at all.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * Boy, remember when Impel Down was this fuck-scary prison that was completely inescapable? Who’s-Who escaped, Moley escaped, Shiki escaped
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            * I’ve never understood why Jinbe is mad here. Yes, I know Who’s-Who is being a racist and all but wasn’t Jinbe supposed to be an Otohime-loving, humans and fish have to put aside their differences kind of guy? He’s either reacting to the two racist statements or he’s reacting to Nika, but it really didn’t seem that he knew anything about Nika. He’s mad at Who’s-Who for the historical inaccuracy, that’s what he says. Who’s-Who barely said anything and Jinbe just completely lost his cool for the first time ever

The cost of your defeat is your freedom and hope”
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        * Yamato is holding Momo by the whiskers

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        * It’s actually a bit obvious in hindsight that Oda was going for the Nika-Nika fruit with the last panel of this chapter showing Luffy with a nika grin; but let’s have an obituary for all the stupid and wrong theories people had at the time. First off, the Nue-Nue. That was stupid and wrong because the Nue-Nue fruit already existed in non-canon material, and as we all know Oda is specifically asked if he has any plans for fruits before they go into the non-canon. I highly doubt that he'd accidently give out the main character’s true fruit for a fucking art promotion. Next, Sun Wukong fruit. This is less stupid than the Nue because of the general influence of Journey to the West on anime and the fact that Oda was very obviously trying to create a Super Saiyan Moment. Its still stupid though, because literally none of the two’s powers align except for strength and endurance. At the moment Nami is more like Sun Wukong than Luffy since she has a staff and a pet cloud. Resin: This actually had a decent piece of evidence this chapter since Luffy appears to melt and Resin is a fluid. But evidence against this was that “resin fruit” doesn’t sound any more intimidating than “rubber fruit” and the WG changed the name for a reason. At this point no one was saying toon powers no matter what anyone says. That wasn’t until next chapter. But even then, it’s still wrong because it misses the mythic god aspect. I saw somebody say it was the “eraser fruit” I have no idea what that guy was talking about
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           * Chapter 1044
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           * Dondottonto the drums of liberation
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           * Luffy is Joyboy, he said it
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           * While I think the concept of the Sun God Nika was an asspull, I don’t think the powerset is an asspull. While there is literally only one direct reference and one circumstantial reference to Nika anywhere in the story there are tons of examples of Luffy having toon powers long before this reveal. The only wrench in the powerset is the interaction with Enel but his body doesn’t react the way rubber would anyway, it follows cartoon physics. I’m serious when I say that I think toon world was the plan from the start, maybe it’s actually the Manga-Manga fruit since Luffy apparently turns white. It wouldn’t be the first time Oda changed the name of a fruit but kept the powers and it made everything seem kind of wrong, remember Katakuri’s flour fruit? And that line of ‘a ridiculous power’ has been said a few times
